edu.rit.pj2.vbl

Class ObjectHistogramVbl<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.vbl.HistogramVbl
      • edu.rit.pj2.vbl.ObjectHistogramVbl<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Object data type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Vbl, Cloneable

    public abstract class ObjectHistogramVbl<T>
extends HistogramVbl
    Class ObjectHistogramVbl is the abstract base class for a histogram that categorizes values of an object type into bins and counts the number of occurrences in each bin. The bin() method determines the bin for a given value; this method must be overridden in a subclass.

    Class ObjectHistogramVbl supports doing a chi-square test on the bin counts. See the chisqr(), pvalue(), and expectedCount() methods.

    Class ObjectHistogramVbl supports the parallel reduction pattern. Each thread creates a thread-local copy of the shared variable by calling the threadLocal() method of class Loop or the threadLocal() method of class Section. Each thread performs operations on its own copy, without needing to synchronize with the other threads. At the end of the parallel statement, the thread-local copies are automatically reduced together, and the result is stored in the original shared variable. The reduction is performed by the shared variable's reduce() method.

      Construct a new histogram with the given number of bins.

    • Method Detail

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(T x)
        Accumulate the given value into this histogram. The bin returned by the bin(x) method is incremented.
        Parameters:
        x - Value.

        protected abstract int bin(T x)
        Determine the bin corresponding to the given value. A subclass must override this method.

        Returns:
        Bin number.
